Expectation1: Perform maintenance and cleaning of the machines to ensure optimal performance
Situation1: A critical bearing is screeching loudly and threatening an immediate breakdown.
Expectation2: Participate in community service and charity work
Situation2: A severe hurricane has left hundreds of people homeless in the community, and the mayor has asked the nun to help organize a major relief effort.
Story:
The shrill screech of the bearing echoed through the factory, vibrating up my arms as I pressed my hand to the trembling metal. I knew what it meant—if I didn’t act now, the whole line could grind to a halt, costing the company thousands and putting my coworkers’ jobs at risk. My tool bag was already open, gloves on, but my phone buzzed urgently in my pocket. It was the mayor, his voice tight with worry: “Sister, we need you. The hurricane’s left so many without homes. Can you help organize the relief center?” 

I could picture the faces of the families huddled in the church basement, waiting for food and comfort, and I felt the weight of my habit pressing on my shoulders. My supervisor’s words from this morning rang in my ears—“We can’t afford any downtime today”—while the mayor’s plea tugged at my heart. I stood frozen, torn between the shriek of the machine and the silent cries of my community, feeling the impossible pull of both worlds demanding all of me at once.
